data.title: Love the architecture.
data.text: Don't forget to check out the amazing Brook Brothers Store. It is quite stunning. Not many good stores, but good place to walk around. Not too many decent food places to eat either. It is connected to the Renaissance Hotel and the Casino.

data.title: It's a shopping mall
data.text:
I'm sure there might be other things going on, but to the casual tourist this is a shopping mall. There's a few decent shops a good food court (as well as individual eateries and a bar or 2) and is also access to the train terminal. It's very light and airy and the main entrance onto the square is very impressive.
I was a bit confused how I came in at one level, changed levels and came back out at road level. But maybe i'm just going mad.

data.title: Cool building, but just a mall
data.text: This is a fantastic structure. Really impressive. But I. The end, it is just a mall. Was a little disappointed the walkway to the Q was shut down. It was really, really cold to walk outside.

data.title: Old School Mall
data.text: Just love this mall with its downtown flavor. It has the right mix of stores and its a great location.

data.title: Enjoyed a quick visit
data.text: We didn't have time to walk around the whole Tower City mall because we paid for a certain amount of time on the parking meter for street parking and had a ways to walk back to our car. However, for the short time we were there, we did enjoy looking in a few stores and enjoyed seeing the nice architecture of the building. A lot is closed in this mall, but there are still some things to check out if you decide to visit here.

data.title: It's all here. Food, shopping, entertainment, hotels, and more
data.text: Lots of dining and shopping choices. Easy access to all forms of public transportation here. Post Office, 2 banks, 10 screen Theater, Casino, 2 hotels and more. Close to everything in the heart of the city. A must see for any traveler. Beautiful staircase and fountains in a striking building. The architecture and design is amazing.

data.title: Beautiful architecture, shops are so so
data.text: Stop by a take a look at the fountain and the architecture of a true Cleveland institution. Unfortunately the stores are more like you'd find in a poor neighborhood. Most are of the dollar store variety. Hope the new ownership will upgrade the mall.

data.title: Opened in 2929
data.text:
Completed and opened in 1929 this is a beautiful Art Deco piece of architecture. Take two elevators to the top (42nd floor) that offers a nice view of the city, the river and Lake Erie. 
On this particular day we were treated to a view of the famous Blue Angels in flight!

data.title: Safe and nice walk everywhere
data.text: Very convenient to have a mall downtown where it is connected with covered walkways. No need to worry about crossing the streets or what the weather is going to be. We felt pretty safe walking around after dinner. There are many stores to shop around as well eating places from food court to fine dinning. It is also connected to the Casino.

data.title: Nice architecture
data.text: This looks like it was a nice shopping area at one time. There are a lot of empty stores now. The architecture design is neat. Still seems to be busy. Food court isn't very large. Parking is a big issue being downtown. Nice to see it once.

data.title: Shopping
data.text: Enjoyed our stroll through this shopping center in the Terminal Tower. Expansive space with plenty of relaxing areas to sit, relax and shop. Attached to the casino.

data.title: A serendipitous misfortune
data.text: Ended up visiting this place after missing a connecting bus to Detroit. It was nearly deserted, even on a beautiful Friday evening. Almost 60% of the stores were closed in this huge huge building. And so were the eateries (except one Japanese joint in the 1st floor). We did go for a late night movie at this place, and again, just the 2 of us in the movie hall (won't mind it though :-P). The view from the mall is good though, overlooking a river and a view of yachts parked around a pier.

data.title: Great little mall and activity center
data.text: Tower City is more than just a public transportation stop from the airport. It has multiple floors with stores, a very nice food court and a fantastic cinema on the first floor!!! I have been here almost every day of my stay in Cleveland. My first stop was a bustling Starbucks that has a large enough staff to accommodate all of the patrons. Very easy walk to anywhere downtown. There is a family dollar, rainbow clothing store, bank and lots of other kiosks and stores inside. The fountain is large and just beautiful.

data.title: Run Down Ghost Town
data.text: Most of the stores in the Center have closed. All of the high end stores moved out a long time ago and now the remaining stores are pulling out as well.  The Center is run down it has not been maintained in a long time. I was told that the Center is going to be revitalized and that is why the stores are leaving as their leases expire. Hopefully this information is true because right now there is no reason to visit. There is a lot of security presence which leads me to believe there are problems with crime.

data.title: Cool place to visit
data.text: This a cool place to visit while in Cleveland. Love the architecture of the building. There several shops and place to eat throughout. Great place to people watch. The food court looks out to the lake. You can access the casino here also.  The building is beautiful at night.

data.title: Great location
data.text: I stayed at the Hotel in the Tower area and was pleased to know that Coffee, lunch and other shopping  choices were available in the lower level of the Center.   There is also a train station in the lower level of the Center.   Great shops and great food choices.

data.title: The center of it all
data.text: Tower City Center is located in the middle of downtown Cleveland in an attractive historic complex.Inside is a spacious shopping mall,with food court,and cinemas.The area is surrounded by hotels, restaurants, a casino and much to do within walking distance.

data.title: fun place to visit
data.text: a lot to see and do here. very unimpressive outside, very impressive on the inside. definitely worth a visit.

data.title: Tower City
data.text: Even if you don't shop here it's still a great place to hang out. A wide variety of shops for all types of taste. If you're into building designs you'll enjoy the lay out and just outside the door is Stark Towers from the Avengers movie and the place where Loki fought Captain America. Great place to take pictures.

data.title: unbelievable building
data.text: We arrived by train.  The interior of the center is spectacular!  I did even think of the shops the building is a wonder.  The walk over view was also great.  What a day!  We headed to Severance Hall the following day.   We do not build things like this any more.  Impressive.
